DataElement.preferredName: Components of Primary Care Instrument 14 This Doctor Knows Me Well as a Person Agreement Score CPCI 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated agreement about whether this doctor knows them well as a person, using a 6-point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Components of Primary Care Instrument This Doctor Knows Me Well as a Person Agreement Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to measure key aspects of the delivery of primary care from the perspective of patients visiting their family physician, and to report the association of these aspects with patient satisfaction._A question about whether an individual's doctor knows the individual well as a person._The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A questionnaire designed to measure key aspects of the delivery of primary care from the perspective of patients visiting their family physician, and to report the association of these aspects with patient satisfaction.

Concepts.definition: A questionnaire designed to measure key aspects of the delivery of primary care from the perspective of patients visiting their family physician, and to report the association of these aspects with patient satisfaction.

Concepts.longName: This Doctor Knows Me Well as a Person
Concepts.definition: A question about whether an individual's doctor knows the individual well as a person.
The act of agreeing to a plan, protocol, or arrangement. Also used to describe a harmony of opinion.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

DataElementConcept.origin: CPCI: Components of Primary Care Instrument; Flocke et al., Journal of Family Practice, July 1997

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 1 to 6, 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 6 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 6 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 5 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 5 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 4 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 4 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 3 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 3 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 2 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 2 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A subjective score of 1 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

Concepts.definition: A subjective score of 1 on a scale that ranges from 1: Strongly Disagree to 6: Strongly Agree.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ValueDomain.origin: CPCI: Components of Primary Care Instrument; Flocke et al., Journal of Family Practice, July 1997

ReferenceDocuments.name: This doctor knows me well as
ReferenceDocuments.description: This doctor knows me well as a person (such as my hobbies, job, etc.).

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

DataElement.origin: CPCI: Components of Primary Care Instrument; Flocke et al., Journal of Family Practice, July 1997
